unnormalised: Okay, here's a blog post on music streaming:
normalised: ditching the C D s my adventures in the world of music streaming

unnormalised: ## Ditching the CDs: My Adventures in the World of Music Streaming
normalised: hey everyone remember the days of meticulously organizing your C D s in those bulky cases or spending hours downloading songs from shady websites hoping they weren’t riddled with viruses those days thankfully feel like a distant dream thanks to the magic of music streaming

unnormalised: Hey everyone! Remember the days of meticulously organizing your CDs in those bulky cases? Or spending hours downloading songs from shady websites, hoping they weren’t riddled with viruses? Those days, thankfully, feel like a distant dream thanks to the magic of music streaming!
normalised: I’ve officially jumped on the streaming bandwagon and honestly I'm never looking back It’s been a game changer especially for my daily commute from Navi Mumbai to Bandra Earlier it was just F M radio and the same old Bollywood hits Now I have access to practically every song under the sun I can switch from listening to A R Rahman’s classics to some obscure Indie artist I discovered last week all within seconds

unnormalised: I’ve officially jumped on the streaming bandwagon and honestly, I'm never looking back. It’s been a game-changer, especially for my daily commute from Navi Mumbai to Bandra. Earlier, it was just FM radio and the same old Bollywood hits. Now? I have access to practically every song under the sun! I can switch from listening to AR Rahman’s classics to some obscure Indie artist I discovered last week, all within seconds.
normalised: My journey started a few months ago My friend Priya a total music guru who went to I I T Delhi and introduced me to practically every cool band out there finally convinced me I was hesitant at first I'm a creature of habit and I had painstakingly curated my M P three collection over years But she pointed out "Dude you're carrying around ten years' worth of music on a phone that probably has more processing power than the computers used to make Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge!"

unnormalised: My journey started a few months ago. My friend Priya, a total music guru who went to IIT Delhi and introduced me to practically every cool band out there, finally convinced me. I was hesitant at first. I'm a creature of habit, and I had painstakingly curated my MP3 collection over years. But, she pointed out, "Dude, you're carrying around 10 years' worth of music on a phone that probably has more processing power than the computers used to make *Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge*!"
normalised: And she was right The sheer convenience is unbeatable I can create playlists for every mood – “chai time with Lata Mangeshkar” “pump up Bollywood dance party” or even “trying to focus while working from home” Plus most platforms have really smart algorithms They've introduced me to so many new artists based on my listening habits It’s like having a personal D J

unnormalised: And she was right. The sheer convenience is unbeatable. I can create playlists for every mood – “chai time with Lata Mangeshkar,” “pump-up Bollywood dance party,” or even “trying to focus while working from home.” Plus, most platforms have really smart algorithms. They've introduced me to so many new artists based on my listening habits. It’s like having a personal DJ!
normalised: Of course there are a few drawbacks Data consumption can be a bit of a concern especially if you're travelling in remote areas with patchy network And the subscription fees – around rupee ninety nine to rupee two hundred and ninety nine per month – do add up But honestly the pros far outweigh the cons

unnormalised: Of course, there are a few drawbacks. Data consumption can be a bit of a concern, especially if you're travelling in remote areas with patchy network. And the subscription fees – around Rs. 99 to Rs. 299 per month – do add up. But honestly, the pros far outweigh the cons.
normalised: So if you're still clinging to your old music collection like I was I urge you to give music streaming a try You might just be surprised at how much you enjoy it What are your favourite music streaming apps and go to playlists Let me know in the comments

unnormalised: So, if you're still clinging to your old music collection like I was, I urge you to give music streaming a try. You might just be surprised at how much you enjoy it! What are your favourite music streaming apps and go-to playlists? Let me know in the comments!
